Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Virtual WAN setup, including bandwidth, latency, redundancy, and security needs. Identify the applications and services that will use Virtual WAN.
Design the network architecture, including hub locations, connections, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Provision the Virtual WAN resource in the Azure portal, ensuring proper configuration of hubs and regions.
Set up hubs in the Virtual WAN, specifying regions and connectivity options. Ensure redundancy by deploying hubs in multiple regions if required.
Configure connections between Virtual WAN hubs and on-premises networks, branch offices, or other Azure regions. Use VPN or ExpressRoute as needed.
Enable security features such as Azure Firewall, encryption for VPN connections, and access control policies to secure the Virtual WAN setup.
Set up routing policies to control traffic flow between hubs, branches, and Azure regions. Define route tables and filters as per design requirements.
Perform thorough testing of the Virtual WAN setup, including failover scenarios, throughput tests, and latency measurements to ensure the network meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for hub status, connection drops, and performance metrics.
Document the Virtual WAN architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Ensure the documentation is accessible to the operations team.
Ensure the Virtual WAN setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Virtual WAN setup.
